text: Caesar Augustus Rodney (January 4, 1772 â€“ June 10, 1824) was an American lawyer and politician from Wilmington, in New Castle County, Delaware. He was a member of the Democratic-Republican Party, who served in the Delaware General Assembly, as well as a U.S. Representative from Delaware, U.S. Senator from Delaware, U.S. Attorney General, and U.S. Minister to Argentina. He was the nephew of Caesar Rodney, the signer of the Declaration of Independence who is pictured on the Delaware state quarter. == References == Category:1772 births Category:1824 deaths Category:Politicians from Wilmington, Delaware Category:United States Attorneys General Category:United States representatives from Delaware Category:United States senators from Delaware Category:Lawyers from Delaware Category:Democratic-Republican Party politicians
title: Caesar A. Rodney
